ol.li: Read through this package insert, the safety data sheet (SDS) and the LUMIPULSE G System Operation Manual. Follow the instructions. Incorrect use of the reagents, instruments, or other consumables may result in unreliable data or accident hazard.

The Total Tau Cartridges (Antibody-Coated Particle Solution / Biotinylated Antibody Solution / Enzyme-Labeled Streptavidin Solution), Total Tau Calibrators set, Substrate Solution, and Wash Solution are packed separately.
The Total Tau Cartridges can be stored on-board the LUMIPULSE G System for a maximum of 30 days.
To ensure measurement accuracy, always use freshly purified water.
Avoid using the reagents which may have been stored in an improper way.

Use new sampling tips and new sample cups as specified by the LUMIPULSE G System Operation Manual. Contact your local distributor, for assessing compatibility of other sample containers with the LUMIPULSE G System.

Bring the Total Tau Calibrators set to room temperature (15-25 °C) before use. Add exactly 1.0 mL of Reconstituting Solution to each lyophilized calibrator. Mix the calibrators by vortexing and use the calibrators as completely dissolved solution. The calibrators after reconstitution may be stored at 2-10 °C for up to 1 week or at -20 °C for up to 2 months when stored in a proper way avoiding contamination and evaporation. Calibrators may not undergo more than 3 freeze-thaw cycles.
Avoid bubbles in sample cups as this can cause sampling errors.
Start the total Tau assay immediately after sample setup to avoid evaporation of the specimen or the calibrators.
Avoid removing the Substrate Solution until it is time to replace it. The Substrate Solution cannot be used if it is contaminated with ALP. Use new gloves when replacing the Substrate Solution.
Replace the Soda lime on the LUMIPULSE G System according to the LUMIPULSE G System Operation Manual.
